title: [Large-Scale] Strategies for Using Graphic Organizers in Medical Education: Learning-by-Doing vs. Learning-by-Watching Comparison

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational medical terminology and human body systems
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-based limited-technology environments, aiming to enhance knowledge structuring abilities of prospective medical professionals

learning_goals: Learners can visualize medical concepts using graphic organizers and explain them with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can compare the advantages and disadvantages of learning-by-doing and learning-by-watching strategies and select appropriate approaches based on learning objectives.
Learners achieve a correct answer rate of 75% or higher in knowledge retention assessments conducted one month later.

resources: Mobile version of Bit Pathways-like learning platform
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
